description: A silky-smooth chocolate cream pie made with an Oreo crust and topped with whipped cream and chocolate shavings.
headline: How To Make the Easiest No-Bake Chocolate Cream Pie

HowtoTip.text: Make ahead: The crust can be filled up to 1 day in advance. Refrigerate the extra whipped cream separately. Top with the whipped cream and chocolate curls just before serving.Storage: Store leftovers, loosely wrapped in plastic wrap, in the refrigerator overnight.

name: How To Make the Easiest No-Bake Chocolate Cream Pie
recipeIngredient: 24 Oreo cookies (2 out of 3 rows of a 14.3-ounce package)
8 tablespoons (1 stick) unsalted butter, melted (save the butter wrapper)
1 (3.9-ounce) box Jell-O instant chocolate pudding mix
Chocolate curls or shavings, for garnish

recipeInstructions.text: Grease the pie plate. Grease a 9-inch deep dish pie plate with the reserved butter wrapper; set aside.

Process Oreos into crumbs. Place the Oreos in the bowl of a food processor fitted with the blade attachment and process until finely ground, about 30 seconds (you should have about 2 heaping cups Oreo crumbs).
Add butter and salt. Add the butter and a pinch of salt and pulse to combine -- the mixture should hold together when pinched between your fingers.

Press the crust into the pie dish. Transfer the mixture to the prepared pie plate. Using a flat-bottomed measuring cup, press it into the bottom and all the way up the sides of the pan. Refrigerate while you make the filling.

Make whipped cream. Place the cream and powdered sugar in the bowl of a stand mixer fitted with the whisk attachment. (Alternatiavely, use an electric hand mixer or a whisk and a large bowl) Beat on medium speed until soft peaks form; set aside.
Make the pudding. Place the pudding mix and milk in a large bowl and whisk vigorously until very thick and no lumps remain, 1 to 2 minutes.

Fold in half of the whipped cream. Using a rubber spatula, fold half of the whipped cream (about 2 cups) into the pudding until well-combined and no streaks remain; refrigerate the remaining whipped cream.

Pour into the crust. Pour the pudding mixture into the crust and use the rubber spatula to smooth the top. Press a piece of plastic wrap directly onto the pudding. Refrigerate until the pudding is set and very firm, at least 4 hours and up to 24.

Top with whipped cream and chocolate curls. Just before serving, top the pie with the reserved whipped cream, spreading it all the way to the edges (you may need to re-whip the cream for about 30 seconds if it has lost its peaks). Garnish with chocolate curls or shavings. For clean slices, wipe the knife in between each slice.
